textPlain: For those interested in details, there's more information at one of the   author's sites than this article which links a paywalled paper.https://eckeraadjustment.web.illinois.edu
Good to see Barry Bonds on top. An eye-opening Chart Party episode showed how ridiculously great he was:https://youtu.be/JwMfT2cZGHg?si=ETq2PbMVglFP5LFb
These kinds of analyses were done back in the 70's and 80's as I recall (Linear Weights, other SABR-published decade corrections, ...).  But I guess if you wait long enough you can republish?
I love Bert Blyleven, but #23???This was a guy who took 14 ballots to get in the Hall of Fame.
He was also a cheater, taking bespoke steroid cocktails, so there's that.
People can do more complex analysis now that we have more computational power, for one thing.
